SEARCH
Package org.example.services

Class LinkService

java.lang.Object
org.example.services.LinkService
public class LinkService extends Object
Service class for managing shortened links.

Provides functionality for creating, editing, opening, and removing shortened links. It also enforces rules and limits defined in the ConfigService.

Key Features:

  • Create shortened links with configurable lifetime and click limits.
  • Open the original URL from a shortened link while respecting activity, expiration, and click limits.
  • Edit click limits and manage link ownership.
  • Remove expired or inactive links from the repository.

  • Constructor Details

    • LinkService

      public LinkService(LinksRepository repository, ConfigService configService)
      Constructor to initialize the LinkService with a repository and a configuration service.
      Parameters:
      repository - The LinksRepository instance to manage links.
      configService - The ConfigService instance to enforce configuration rules.

  • Method Details

    • createShortLink

      public ShortLink createShortLink(UUID userId, String originalUrl, int clicksLimit, int lifetimeHours)
      Creates a shortened link for a given user and URL.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user creating the shortened link.
      originalUrl - The original URL to be shortened.
      clicksLimit - The maximum number of clicks allowed for the shortened link.
      lifetimeHours - The lifetime of the link in hours.
      Returns:
      The created ShortLink object.

    • openLink

      public void openLink(String shortUrl)
      Opens the original URL for a given shortened URL.

      If the link is expired, inactive, or exceeds the click limit, it is disabled and removed.

      Parameters:
      shortUrl - The shortened URL to open.

    • editLimit

      public boolean editLimit(UUID userId, String shortUrl, int newLimit)
      Changes the click limit for a given shortened URL.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user requesting the change.
      shortUrl - The shortened URL whose limit is to be changed.
      newLimit - The new click limit.
      Returns:
      true if the limit was successfully updated; false otherwise.

    • removeLink

      public boolean removeLink(UUID userId, String shortUrl)
      Removes a shortened URL from the repository.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user requesting the removal.
      shortUrl - The shortened URL to be removed.
      Returns:
      true if the link was successfully removed; false otherwise.

    • removeExpiredLinks

      public void removeExpiredLinks()
      Removes all expired links from the repository.
